title: Cost-sensitive Learning for Imbalanced Data
description: Imbalanced data is a common yet challenging problem in Machine Learning.
Multi-class classification adds another level of complexity.
I this article, I show a possible way of dealing with the problems - cost-sensitive learning.
You can learn how to implement it using scikit-learn.

title: Pay Attention to Your Neighbors
description: An article about human language. I wrote about challenges of understanding the human language.
To illustrate the problem, I gave several examples of homonyms.
I showed how one of my favorite NLP Libraries - spaCy - recognizes the correct Part of Speech.
There are multiple rules about words' neighborhood that are helpful to accomplish the task.

title: Simple Yet Powerful: An Introduction to Named Entities
description: Named Entities are real-world objects, that have a unique representation.
In text, they're capitalized. This makes them easy to detect.
They belong to categories like: Names, Countries, Organizations.
When used in a creative way, they become a powerful tool. They boost task like: Content Recommendation, Listing Tags.
In the article, I show how to find Named Entities using, again, spaCy.

title: Recognize Proactive People By the Language They Use
description: The first article I ever wrote. Originally, I posted it on LinkedIn in November 2020.
This is still the only article about personal growth I decided to write.
7 Habits of Highly Effective People is the most important book I read.
In the article, I'm giving personal insights about the first habit: Be proactive.
